discussion.content: B correct
B is the right answer
The size of the bin decides the intervals on the axis and is set according to the values in the field

Selected Answer: B
To construct a histogram, the first step is to "bin" (or "bucket") the range of values—that is, divide the entire range of values into a series of intervals—and then count how many values fall into each interval. The bins are usually specified as consecutive, non-overlapping intervals of a variable.

questions.question_text: When creating a histogram in Tableau, to what does bin size refer?

choices.D: The minimum number of axis ticks in the view
choices.C: The count distinct (COUNTD) of items on either axis
choices.A: The maximum number of marks in the view
choices.B: The range of the continuous measure counted in each bin

choices.D: From the Connections pane, select Add

comments.content: The question does not say "calculated field," it says "field." In addition, the drop-down menu of the field in the Data Source tab does not give an option to change the data type. That can be done using the icon.

discussion.content: Option C is not a correct method to change the data type of a field in general, because it only works for fields that were part of the original data source, not calculated fields. Option D is correct, but it's not the only one. Option A is also correct, because it allows you to change the data type of any field on the Data Source tab. so the corerect answer is A and D

Selected Answer: CD
Not A - the drop-down menu show : rename, ... , but not include change data type

Data Source Tab : (Data type Icon, YES)(Field Drop Down Menu, NO)
Data Pane: (Data type Icon, YES)(Field Drop Down Menu, YES)

Selected Answer: AC
AC also correct, You can change the data type for a field either on the Data Source page or in the Data pane

https://help.tableau.com/current/pro/desktop/en-us/datafields_typesandroles_datatypes.htm

comments.content: It cannot be A, there is no option in the drop-down menu of the "field" to change its data type. But clicking the data type icon, yes.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
CD correct
CD is the answer

Selected Answer: CD
CD 100%
CD correct.

There are three ways to change the data type for a data field:

Right-click on the data field name, click on Change data type, and choose the new data type from the drop-down.
Click on the data type icon to the left of the data field name and choose the new data type from the drop-down.
Click on the data type icon on the Data Source page and choose the new data type from the drop-down.

choices.A: From the Data Source tab, click on the drop-down menu of the field
choices.C: From the Data Source tab, click the data type icon of the field
choices.D: From the Data pane, click on the drop-down menu of the field
choices.B: From the Data pane, select and hold the field
